overview: Siraj Khaliq is currently the Chief Technical Officer of The Climate Corporation, which he founded with David Friedberg in 2006 (the company was called WeatherBill until 2011). Prior to starting this venture, Siraj worked at Google in lead engineering roles on several high-profile projects, in particular Google Book Search and other offline content search initiatives. Siraj obtained an MS degree in Computer Science from Stanford University, and a BA (Hons.) in Computer Science from the University of Cambridge, England. While at Stanford, he was also a lead software architect for the popular Folding@Home distributed computing project.
